content: The backup on cpanel may have been done while Thunderbird was running. My suggestion is to unzip the file and manually copy the profile components. If unsure, post screenshot of thunderbird profile after the unzip.
creator: davidsk

content:
These steps will do it all:

Here is the link for moving a profile in Windows when installed in default location: 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is NOT running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  8. start thunderbird and all should be there
creator: davidsk

content:
I suggest looking a the folder in windows file explorer. You can do that by this:

  1. click help>troubleshootinginformation
  2. scroll down to 'profile folder' on left side and click 'open folder'
  3. you are now in profile. click the imapmail folder and then the account folder
  4. you should now be viewing the message folders, inbox, sent, etc. If there have been any problems in the past, there may be multiple copies of folders that are not being used. There may also be some NSTMP files that were created when a compaction failed. If you would like assistance, Please post a screenshot of the folder. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content:
when changing IMAP web hosts, and needing to save messages, this works

  1. check account settings>synchronization&storage to verify that the folders can be downloaded
  2. then, click file>offline>download to ensure that all messages and headers are downloaded
  3. next, copy the message folders to local storage. a possible approach would be to use the importexporttools addon and do this:
    • highlight local folders
    • rightclick and select importexport option to import mbox
    • then, locate and select the message folder (not the msf file) in your profile at the imapmail\<accountname> folder in profile.
    • you will now have all messages in local folders so you can safely remove the old account
creator: davidsk

content:
A primary password is optional and created by the user. If you have forgotten the password, you can reset the account.

  1. Choose Tools -> Developer Tools > Error Console and then paste the expression: 
  openDialog("chrome://pippki/content/resetpassword.xhtml")
  1. the, press the Evaluate button. That will open a dialog asking you if you want to reset your password. If Evaluate is not seen, press enter key.
  2. When prompted, press the Reset button.
creator: davidsk

content:
Windows 7 - so version 115.18.0 is the last version which can operate on a Win 7 OS.

I'm trying to find out if there was an old bug on this, but regardless you cannot update whilst using a Win7 OS.

Does the issue still occur if you restart Thunderbird in 'Troubleshoot Mode' ? What addon extensions do you use? I'm wondering if there is a conflict due to an addon.

F as short cut will go to next message in folder Ctrl+F is shortcut to Find in this message

So it sounds like your computer thought you had pressed either of the above. In which case please make sure your keyboard does not have a dirty contact for the Shift and Ctrl keys.

Maybe you have got a Win7 setup interfering like a sticky key setting. Take a look at this link: https://support.microsoft.com/en-gb/windows/make-the-keyboard-easier-to-use-in-windows-7-c74e835a-dce9-a545-fae0-1dc7497e534f
creator: Toad-Hall

content: This indicates the issue may be in the SMTP server setup. The email provider wants authentication, but it appears that the settings don't provide it. Maybe if you post a screenshot of your SMTP server settings pane, someone here will have suggestions,
creator: davidsk

content:
What OS are you using? What version of Thunderbird are you using ? Are you talking about an imap or pop mail account? Do you mean you cannot download any emails? Is the problem just downloading mail OR do you also have a problem sending email?

Are you able to download when you start Thunderbird, but it fails to download subsequently? What error message are you getting when you click on 'Get Messages' ? Post an image of the error message OR tell us the exact error message word for word verbatim.

In Thunderbird

  • Help > Troubleshooting Information
  • Scroll down to 'Mail and News accounts' section
  • Either copy all the data in that section and past it into this forum OR post an image showing data in the section.

Comcast uses Xfinity server.

  • Logon to the comcast webmail account via a browser.
  • Please confirm you can access the account - this proves the password is correct and you know it.
  • Then use info at the following link and confirm you have enabled third party access.
  • https://www.xfinity.com/support/articles/third-party-email-access

Confirm third party access checkbox has been selected. Whilst logged on to webmail account....confirm there are new emails which have not been downloaded to Thunderbird account.

Check to see if the download problem is because you are not actually receiving any emails on server. So whilst looking at webmail account... If you have reached your quota limit - used up amount of allowed stored space on server then server cannot accept any emails until you make some space. I ask this because Thunderbird will not be able to download if nothing is able to arrive on the server. You would need to delete a load of emails off the server to create some space. If you use a Pop account then you are ok as emails are stored on your computer, BUT if you use an Imap account in Thunderbird then it can only display whatever is on server - in which case - in Thunderbird, get copies of important old emails 'Copied' into a folder in 'Local Folders' account BEFORE you delete them off the server.

Report back on whether quota had reached max and no new mail on server.
creator: Toad-Hall
